attributes.magic: PE32 executable (console) Intel 80386, for MS Windows

compiler_product_versions: [ C ] VS2022 v17.1.0 pre 1.0 build 30818 count=18

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects command variations typically used by ransomware
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: ditekSHen

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Yara rule that detects BlackBasta ransomware.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: ReversingLabs

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered ransomware. Other contributing factors were that it has known exploits and it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert icmp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Unusual PING detected"; icode:0; itype:8; fragbits:!M; content:!"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWABCDEFGHI",depth 32; content:!"0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv",depth 32; content:!"EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE",depth 36; content:!"WANG2"; content:!"cacti-monitoring-system",depth 65; content:!"SolarWinds",depth 72; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-closer-look-at-the-target-malware-part-ii/; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-first-look-at-the-target-intrusion-malware/; classtype:successful-recon-limited; sid:29456; rev:3; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING Windows"; itype:8; content:"abcdefghijklmnop",depth 16; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:382; rev:11; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING"; icode:0; itype:8; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:384; rev:8; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Echo Reply"; icode:0; itype:0; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:408; rev:8; )

match_context.values: @{TerminalSessionId=1; ProcessGuid={C784477D-3C10-633F-4E06-000000003000}; ProcessId=3352; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Command Line Interface for Microsoft\xae Volume Shadow Copy Service ; Company=Microsoft Corporation; ParentProcessGuid={C784477D-3C0F-633F-4C06-000000003000}; User=DESKTOP-B0T93D6\george; Hashes=MD5=47D51216EF45075B5F7EAA117CC70E40,SHA256=C946C4EDA61355A1B8E134E7A184A15C9A358B9675B6172A83E4937AE9EF4B03,IMPHASH=C1EDC431CD345F0A0F32019895D13FCE; OriginalFileName=VSSADMIN.EXE; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentProcessId=5924; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; CommandLine=C:\Windows\SysNative\vssadmin.exe  delete shadows /all /quiet; EventID=1; LogonGuid=C784477D-1E28-62FF-F7D6-030000000000; LogonId=251639; Image=C:\Windows\System32\vssadmin.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /c C:\Windows\SysNative\vssadmin.exe delete shadows /all /quiet; UtcTime=1665088528; RuleName=-}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects process creation events that use the Sysnative folder (common for CobaltStrike spawns)
